Jeremy Parish of Retronauts criticized the series` use of redundant new Pokémon, commenting that Woobat was the same as Zubat, referencing the uncanny similarities in name. IGN`s Jack DeVries questioned whether Woobat would act as a Zubat replacement. He later expressed that despite being unsure of Woobat`s quality, he wrote that "at least he`s not a Zubat". 1UP.com`s Kat Bailey wrote that Woobat was basically a Zubat with a pig`s snout. 1UP.com`s Michael Vreeland wrote that Woobat was "a lot more interesting" than Zubat. G4TV`s Nikole Zivalich, however wrote that Woobat was derivative and inferior to Zubat and that while fans will appreciate not having to run into so many Zubats, the "alternative isn`t much better". Carolyn Gudmundson of GamesRadar similarly described Woobat as the "new Zubat", noting that based on their looks, it and its evolution are two of their favourite Pokémon; however, they do note that they have some faults gameplay-wise.

character.name: Pendror
character.description: Scolipede, known as the Mega Centipede Pokémon, is the evolved form of Whirlipede. Scolipede is a centipede-like Pokémon, with bright magenta coloration with purple rings spaced evenly along its segmented upper body. It will chase down enemies with its fast movements and attack them with the horn on its head. It is to date the largest Bug-type Pokémon at 8`02". It gives no mercy until it strikes the final blow. It makes the claws on its neck dig into its opponent and injects poison. It has a very aggressive personality. A wild Scolipede appears in The Bloom is on Axew. Iris`s Axew falls out of a tree and gets caught in Scolipede`s antennae. This startles Scolipede and causes it to go on a rampage, until Iris`s Excadrill decides to defeat it with its Drill Run attack. A Scolipede also appeared in Emolga The Irresistible, after Bianca blasted it with her Pignite`s Flamethrower.

character.name: Meguroco
character.description: Sandile, known as the Desert Croc Pokémon, is a mainly tan colored crocodile-like Pokémon with a pink underbelly, black stripes, and black rimmed eyes. To prevent their body temperature from dropping, they bury in the sands of the desert, akin to some real desert dwelling species. It moves along below the sand`s surface, with its nose and eyes sticking out. The dark membrane in its eyes shields them from the sun. In the anime, a group of Sandile appeared in A Sandile Gusher of Change!, trying to lead a bunch of Pokémon to safety. The leader of the group, which has a pair of sunglasses, has since become a reoccurring character, and evolves into a Krokorok. In the Pokémon Adventures manga, a Sandile is one of the Pokémon employed by White in her BW Agency.

character.name: Yabukuron
character.description: Trubbish is known as the Trash Bag Pokémon. It is said that a trash bag that is thrown away chemically reacted with waste to become this Pokémon. It likes dirty places such as waste deposits. Despite finding Black and White`s Pokémon to be well-designed, IGN`s Audrey Drake found Trubbish and its evolution to be contrary to this. IGN AU`s Cam Shea mocked it, jokingly stating that nothing was cuter than an "anthropomorphic bag of garbage"; he jokingly suggested that they make similar Pokémon called "Mediwastical" and "Stinkydiaperino".

character.name: Swanna
character.description: Swanna, known as the White Bird Pokémon, is a swan-like Pokémon. With a long yellow bill, it administers sharp, powerful pecks. It whips its long neck to deliver forceful repeated strikes. Swanna start dancing at night, and dance around the leader of the flock. In the games, Swanna can be found flying around Marvelous Bridge. In the anime, a flock of Swanna appeared in In The Shadow of Zekrom!. A Swanna later appeared under the ownership of Officer Jenny. In the Pokémon Master Black & White manga, a Pokémon Ranger used one with his Zebstrika in a double battle against Monta.

character.name: Mamanbou
character.description: Alomomola, known as the Caring Pokémon, is a heart-shaped pink fish Pokémon with large dorsal and ventral fins. As it floats around in the ocean, it carries wounded Pokémon to shore. With their special membrane, they heal the Pokémon`s wounds. Alomomola first makes an appearance in the anime "In The Shadow of Zekrom!", as a wild Pokémon. It was the first Pokémon in the Unova region that Ash saw. Game Informer`s Jeff Marchiafava criticized its "nearly-unpronounceable name", and stated that it being a "Caring Pokémon" makes it a pacifist.

character.name: Miruhog
character.description: Watchog, known as the Precaution Pokémon, is the evolved form of Patrat. It attacks by hurling the seeds of berries collected in its cheek sacs. When it spots an enemy it stands its tail erect. It makes the patterns on its body shine in order to intimidate enemies. It has eyes that can see its surroundings even in the dark. In the anime, Nacrene City Gym Leader Lenora has a Watchog and she uses it in "A Night in the Nacrene City Museum!!" where it used its ability to reveal Yamask`s presence. She then uses it against Ash in his Gym Battle in "The Battle Acconding to Lenora" where it defeats his Oshawott with Thunderbolt. It appears once more in "Rematch at the Nacrene Gym!", where it is defeated by Oshawott`s Aqua Jet. Game Informer`s Jeff Marchiafava described Watchog as a "pissed-off meerkat", and further calling it a "disgruntled-looking jerk". An editor for GamesRadar included it in a satirical character battle between their "ultimate hated characters".

character.name: Kokoromori
character.description: Swoobat, known as the Courting Pokémon, evolves from Woobat by leveling it up when its happiness is high. Happiness can be raised by fighting through many Pokémon battles, having the Pokémon in your party or feeding it vitamins. Swoobat is a blue bat-like Pokémon with a white mane of fur, a heart shaped nose, and a vaguely heart shape at the end of its tail. The sound waves it emits from its nose are of a frequency powerful enough to destroy rocks. The ultrasonic waves emitted by a courting male causes people to have a positive mood.

character.name: Fushide
character.description: Venipede, known as the Centipede Pokémon, is a red insect-like Pokémon with a green band around its body. While some large birds try to prey on it, Venipede`s bite has enough poison to paralyze them. Brutally aggressive, it discovers what is going on around it by using the feelers on its head and tail. A swarm of Venipede appear in Best Wishes! episode 22 "A Venipede Stampede!".

character.name: Iwapalace
character.description: Crustle is the evolution of Dwebble and is called the Stone Home Pokémon, by virtue of the large slab that it carries. Crustle makes its` anime debut in "Crisis at Chargestone Cave" where Cilan`s Dwebble evolves into one while it was enduring Jessie`s Woobat`s Gust attack.

character.name: Mebukijika
character.description: Sawsbuck, known as the Seasonal Pokémon. The evolved form of Deerling. Its horns carry flowers which change with the season. The leader of the herd has the most splendid horns. The Escapist listed Sawsbuck as one of the new Pokémon with "really cool designs", describing it as "the incredibly manly evolution of the incredibly cute deer".

character.name: Koaruhie
character.description: Ducklett is known as the Water Bird Pokémon. They are light blue, gosling-like Pokémon. They have two feathery tufts on their heads connected at the bottom, forming a `v` shape. It has a darker blue, feathery underside which makes it appear as if it were mi-moult. It had yellow, webbet feet and a beak and a small tail. A trio of Ducklett appear in the Black & White episode "Dancing With the Ducklett Trio" where they attack Ash and his friends, stealing some of their belongings, including Ash`s hat and the wild Sandile`s sunglasses.

character.name: Baoppu
character.description: Pansear is known as the High Tempature Pokémon. It is part of a trio that seems to be inspired by the three wise monkeys motif; with its hand by its ear, Pansear represents "hear no evil". It resides in caves near volcanoes. When it is angry, the temperature of the tuft on its head increases to over 300 degrees Celsius. In the anime, Pansear appears under the ownership of Chili, where it loses in a battle against Ash`s Tepig. Pansear learns Fire Blast at level 34.

character.name: Baokkie
character.description: Simisear, known as the Ember Pokémon, evolves from Pansear when a Fire Stone is used on it. It scatters embers from its head and tail to sear its opponents. It also enjoys sweets, as they become energy for the fire burning in its body.

character.name: Hiyappu
character.description: Panpour is known as the Spray Pokémon. It is part of a trio that seems to be inspired by the three wise monkeys motif; with its eyes closed, Panpour represents "see no evil". It used to live in forests in ancient times, but its body changed so it could live on the waterside more easily. It can store water in the tuft on its head. In the anime, Panpour appears under the ownership of Cress, where it wins in a battle against Ash`s Pikachu.

character.name: Hiyakkie
character.description: Simipour, known as the Geyser Pokémon, evolves from Panpour when a Water Stone is used on it. The tuft on its head holds water. When the water level is running low, it will siphon water using its tail. The water which is expelled from its tail is of such high pressure that it can destroy concrete.

character.name: Tabunne
character.description: Audino, is known as the Hearing Pokémon. With its big ears, it can access other Pokémon`s emotions and health. It also has the power to understand its surroundings through slight sounds. Audino replaces Chansey and Blissey as the preferred companions of Pokémon Center nurses in the Unova Region, despite its gender ratio being equally balanced. Players often search incessantly for it, as it gives an enormous amount of Experience Points when defeated, making the training of a Pokémon slightly easy. It also is a Pacifist, based on its healer ability. It can, despite being a pure-normal type, learn nine Psychic-type moves, with two more from breeding.

character.name: Yorterry
character.description: Lillipup is known as the Puppy Pokémon. The long hairs covering its face are excellent radars. It delicately senses the state of its surroundings. In the anime, Lillipup appeared under the ownership of Lenora, where it won in a battle against Ash`s Tepig. Later, when it evolved into a Herdier, it lost against Ash`s Tepig during the Rematch in "Rematch At The Nacrene City Gym." GamesRadar`s Carolyn Gudmundson noted it as being initially weak, but becomes quite powerful in its final evolution. Official Nintendo Magazine`s Chris Schilling called Lillipup the new Rattata.

character.name: Mooland
character.description: Stoutland, known as the Big-Hearted Pokémon, is a dog-like Pokémon that is the final evolution of Lillipup. It looks very similar to Herdier, its pre-evolved form, with a brown base coat, black-gray thicker fur, and white-cream thick fur on its face like a long mustache. Stoutland are very talented at saving people, especially people stranded in the mountains or at sea. Its thick fur protects it from freezing cold temperatures.

character.name: Choroneko
character.description: Purrloin, known as the Devious Pokémon, is a purple feline Pokémon. It plays with and steals people`s belongings. Even the people it steals from unconsciously forgive it due to its charming behavior. Its adorable behavior causes people to let down their guard, and it takes that opportunity to steal their belongings. If it gets mad it will fight back with its claws. GamesRadar`s Carolyn Gudmundson noted it and its evolution as a decent Dark-type pair, though the stats are somewhat low.

character.name: Zebraika
character.description: Zebstrika, known as the Thunderbolt Pokémon, is the evolved form of Blitzle. It is known for its ill tempered nature, and when its angry, the lightning that shoots from its mane goes in all directions.

character.name: Dotekkotsu
character.description: Gurdurr, known as the Muscular Pokémon, is the evolved form of Timburr. Gurdurr are so strong and muscular they will not move when attacked by a group of pro wrestlers. They carry I-shaped steel beams to increase this muscle, which is shown off to friends.

character.name: Roubushin
character.description: Conkeldurr, known as the Muscular Pokémon, is the final evolution of Timburr. They are burly humanoid Pokémon and use two stone pillars, one in each hand, as walking canes which can be freely swung around in battle. Apparently, they taught humans how to make concrete over two millennia ago.

character.name: Nageki
character.description: Throh, known as the Judo Pokémon, is a red, fat human-like Pokémon wearing a white and black martial arts outfit. When it tightens its belt, it becomes stronger. Wild Throh use vines to weave their own belts. Always traveling in packs of five, they throw foes that are bigger than them.

character.name: Dageki
character.description: Sawk, known as the Karate Pokémon, is a blue, thin human-like Pokémon wearing a white and black martial arts outfit. The sound of Sawk punching boulders and trees can be heard all the way from the mountains where they train. Tying their belts gets them pumped and makes their punches more destructive. Disturbing their training angers them.

character.name: Dredear
character.description: Lilligant, known as the Flowering Pokémon, evolves from Petilil when exposed to a Sun Stone. It has pollen on its head, and resembles a flowering plant. A Lilligant will wither when it is not treated well. Lilligant is a female-only species. Lilligant can be found rarely in White version.

character.name: Basslao
character.description: Basculin, known as the Hostile Pokémon, is a green and black colored fish. It has two forms which main difference is a colored stripe and the player encounters one form more commonly depending on the game version; red-striped Basculin are more common in Black, while the blue-striped variety is more common in White. Game Informer`s Jeff Marchiafava praised its categorization as the "Hostile Pokémon", stating "Now here`s a category I can get behind". They criticized its abilities for contradicting each other.

character.name: Zuruggu
character.description: Scraggy, known as the Shedding Pokémon. Once it locks eyes with an opponent, it launches a Headbutt attack without warning. It often pulls its pelt up to its neck, because the pelt protects it with its rubber-like elasticity. It will suddenly headbutt opponents that meet its gaze with a very thick cranium. In the anime, Ash obtains a Pokémon egg which hatches into a Scraggy.

character.name: Zuruzukin
character.description: Scrafty, known as the Hoodlum Pokémon, is the evolution of Scraggy. It is said the Scrafty with the biggest crest is the group`s leader. Their skin looks like shedded Scraggy skin.

character.name: Gothimu
character.description: Gothita, known as the Fixation Pokémon, is a human-like baby Pokémon with purple skin, and black and white clothes. It has three bows, and a small tuft of hair. Their bows increase their psychic abilities. Gothita closely observe both Trainers and Pokémon, looking at something that only they can see. They are a version exclusive Pokémon and are only obtainable in Pokémon Black version.

character.name: Gothimiru
character.description: Gothorita, known as the Manipulate Pokémon, is a human-like, little girlish Pokémon, with purple skin, black hair, and black and white clothing. Gothorita often use hypnosis to control Pokémon and people alike, leading them astray. While charging up their power by starlight, they mark the star`s positions with floating stones.

character.name: Unilan
character.description: Solosis, known as the Cell Pokémon, is a small green Pokémon surrounded in a green gel, with a red mouth, and a yellow spring-like figure coming out of its head. They can survive in any environment because of their body`s special liquid envelope. They can use telepathy to talk with others, and drive away attackers by unleashing psychic power. They are a version exclusive Pokémon and are only obtainable in Pokémon White version.

character.name: Doublan
character.description: Duosion is known as the Mitosis Pokémon. It is a small,green, circle Pokémon surrounded in green gel. It has a floating portion on top of its main `body`. That is its second brain. When their brains, now divided in two, are thinking the same thoughts, these Pokémon exhibit their maximum power, and since they have two divided brains, at times they suddenly try to take two different actions at once.

character.name: Vanipeti
character.description: Despite finding the overall designs in Black and White to be good, IGN`s Audrey Drake found Vanillite and its line to be contrary to this. Fellow IGN editor Sam Claiborn scoffed at the idea of a "walking ice cream cone".

character.name: Vanirich
character.description: Vanillish is known as the Icy Snow Pokémon. It is small, white, blue, and it`s shaped like a single scoop, vanilla ice cream cone. "Snowy mountains are this Pokémon`s habitat. During an ancient ice age, they moved to southern areas, and it conceals itself from enemy eyes by creating many small ice particles and hiding among them.

character.name: Baivanilla
character.description: Vanilluxe, known as the Snowstorm Pokémon, is the final form of Vanillite. It represents a cone of ice cream with two scoops. One of the scoops has a straw-like figure which has mist flowing out of it. They can create snow clouds inside their body by swallowing large amounts of water. They use this to attack their foes with violent blizzards. If both heads are angry at the same time, the blizzard created by this Pokémon buries everything in snow. Official Nintendo Magazine`s Chris Schilling used Vanilluxe as an example of a unique Pokémon in this generation compared to the safer ones earlier in the game.

character.name: Emonga
character.description: Emolga is a flying squirrel-like Pokémon. Emolga is in white appearance, possesses yellow plane-like wings, allowing it to fly in any direction. On its back is extremely black colored, and making a black helmet-like on its head with bat-like ears with yellow and white in the inner part. Emolga also has a black pointy tail and dark red colored eyes. It releases electricity from its membranes when it flies. The electricity is created in its cheek`s electrical pouches. Living in the top of the forest, its cape shines with electricity when it glides. In the Pokémon Master Black & White manga, Monta captures an Emolga using his Snivy. In a poll by Official Nintendo Magazine, Emolga was voted as one of the best Pokémon from Black and White. Editor Thomas East compared it to Pikachu, and called it cute. In the Best Wishes! anime series, Iris captures a female Emolga in the episode "Emolga the Irresistible!"

character.name: Tamagetake
character.description: Foongus, known as the Mushroom Pokémon, is a mushroom-like Pokémon whose cap resembles a Poké Ball. It emits poisonous spores when people are lured to its Poké Ball-like cap. The spores it releases repels enemies if they try to capture it.

character.name: Morobareru
character.description: Amoonguss, the Mushroom Pokémon, has Pokéball designs on its cap and hands. Its pre-evolution and the Voltorb family do too, although the Voltorb family doesn`t include the button in their designs.

character.name: Dentula
character.description: Galvantula, known as the Electric Spider Pokémon. It uses electrically-charged hairy strings to attack its targeted prey. It uses the feelers on its front jaw to pin an enemy down or to slice it into pieces. Galvantula`s Japanese name is a play on "Den" (電), a Japanese word that refers to electricity, and tarantula. A group of Galvantula appear in Episode 17 "Scraggy, Hatched to be Wild!" where they paralyze Ash`s Scraggy. In a poll by Official Nintendo Magazine, Galvantula was voted as the best Pokémon from Black and White. Editor Thomas East described it as "a great yellow and blue spider capable of capturing its opponents with its electric thread", and stated that it is "Not exactly a Pokemon you`d want to take home to meet the family".

character.name: Shibishirasu
character.description: Tynamo, known as the Electric Eel Pokémon. It is based on young electric eels and lampreys. A single Tynamo`s electrical power is tiny, but when a group comes together, that power is "as mighty as thunder". These Pokémon move in schools. They have an electricity-generating organ, so they discharge electricity if in danger.

character.name: Shibirudon
character.description: Eelektross, known as the Electric Fish Pokémon, is the evolution of Eelektrik. It evolves from Eelektrik when it contacts a Thunderstone. Eelektross is an eel-like Pokémon that resembles a lamprey, with a long tentacle-like, finned limb extending from its head. It has red eyes, dark blue body, and, unlike its earlier evolutions, possesses clawed, paddle-like arms with yellow spots and yellow-and-red palms. It has a beige fin on the upper portion of its body and beige fin-like legs below. It is also the final evolution of Tynamo. Eelektross and its evolutionary relatives are the only Pokémon to have no weaknesses other than Ghost/Dark. However, this is due to their Levitate ability, which eliminates what would be their sole weakness to the Ground type.

character.name: Kumasyun
character.description: Cubchoo, known as the Chill Pokémon, is based on a polar bear cub. Cubchoo is constantly plagued by a cold and a runny nose. It will sniff up its mucus during attacks and then use it to fight with. When it becomes sicker and the mucus becomes too runny, its ice attacks become weaker. Cubchoo were given out for a promotional event in the games Pokémon Black and Pokémon White in Japan from October 22, 2010 to November 29, 2010.

character.name: Muggyo
character.description: Stunfisk is a dual-type Ground/Electric Pokémon introduced in Generation V. It is not known to evolve into or from any other Pokémon. In Galar, Stunfisk has a Ground/Steel-type regional form. Stunfisk is a flat, fish-like Pokémon with a broad, mud-brown body. At the base of its yellow tail is a yellow marking shaped like an exclamation mark when seen from behind. It has small, horizontal, oval-shaped eyes, white with a tiny black pupil and no irises. Almost exactly between these two eyes lies the two thick gray lips that form its mouth. It has two small, flimsy fins at the sides of its body; each with two lobes. It has been seen to leap into the air and flap its fins as if they`re wings to remain airborne. Stunfisk`s very tough skin keeps them unharmed if stepped on, even by sumo wrestlers. To exploit this, it buries itself in mud of the seashore and waits for prey to pass by. Whenever unsuspecting prey touch a Stunfisk`s body, it is zapped. Stunfisk smiles when electrocuting its foes. If it cannot paralyze its foe, it contorts itself with unexpected speed and flops away. Galarian Stunfisk is grayish-brown, with three green markings similar to footprints on its body. It cannot generate electricity, but the high iron content of the mud it lives in has strengthened its fins, which have been adapted into an apparatus akin to a bear trap. Galarian Stunfisk leaves its red and white lips visible to lure in prey, and then slams its fins shut on them so they cannot escape. It is the only known Pokémon capable of using the move Snap Trap.

character.name: Kojofu
character.description: Mienfoo, known as the Martial Arts Pokémon is a Fighting-Type Pokémon based on a Mustelid and a Buddhist Monk. It is a yellow, two-legged mustelid-like Pokémon, with round ears, red eyes, round black "eyebrows", and pink nose with a whisker on each side. Its red arms look similar to flared sleeves, and the paws are yellow. Mienfoo`s chest has a small red band, and its pelt piles around its thighs like a tunic or robe of some sort. Its legs are red, and its yellow tail is also tipped in the color.

character.name: Kojondo
character.description: Mienshao, known as the Martial Arts Pokémon, is a Fighting-type Pokémon & the evolution of Mienfoo. Like its pre-evolution, it is based on a Mustelid, doing Whip fighting, Taekwondo and Kokondo. It is Black in color & has a long body. Its head is small in size and has small, triangle shaped ears. Its forehead has a purple spot adorning it as well as a yellow one on its snout. It possesses a pair of long, yellow tipped whiskers which have split ends. Its arms are almost completely covered by a large amount of fur that is tipped in purple and split at the end. This arm fur is used as a weapon in battle and acts like a battle whip. Its torso has one purple ring of fur around its midsection. It also has purple fur on the bottom section of the torso, which resemble pants, and its bottom paws are clawed. It has a long, skinny tail that, like its paw fur, is tipped purple and split at its end.

character.name: Sazandora
character.description: Hydreigon, known as the Brutal Pokémon, is the evolution of Zweilous, and final stage of Deino. Hydreigon is a three-headed bipedal dragon with six wings. It is extremely vicious and destructive as it travels the skies, attacking anything that moves. Its duplicate heads do not have brains, but are used to eat and attack. Hydreigon appears in the Nintendo 3DS download Pokédex 3D, where it was featured as one of the first collectible Pokémon. A Hydreigon under the ownership of Carlita appeared in Pokémon the Movie: Black - Victini and Reshiram and White - Victini and Zekrom. It appears to have shiny coloration in the White version of the film, while being normal colored in the Black version. Official Nintendo Magazine`s Chris Schilling used Hydreigon as an example of a unique Pokémon in this generation compared to the safer ones earlier in the game.

character.name: Matori
character.description: Matori is Giovanni`s secretary and a member of Team Rocket. She became his main reference for current operations when the Team Rocket began to infiltrate the Unova region. She kept Jessie, James, Meowth informed of their mission and was the one that suggested they be the Team Rocket members for his special mission there to find out information about Dream Energy and the Meteonite. After the events in the Unova desert, Matori gave Jessie, James, Meowth the runaround when they tried to contact Giovanni and Matori explained that Giovanni was in the middle of an important meeting and couldn`t leave it to talk to them. Matori forwarded Giovanni`s message to them stating, "From now, you`re free to do what you want. Do your best for the sake of the Rocket Gang."

character.name: Pansy
character.description: Alexa is a journalist who works at a publishing house in Lumiose City. She is Viola`s elder sister who is the Santalune City Gym Leader.

character.name: Erikiteru (Pansy)
character.description: Alexa`s Helioptile was the first 6th generation Pokémon to appear in the anime series.

character.name: Erikiteru
character.description: Helioptile, the Generator Pokémon, is a solar powered and lizard-like Electric Pokémon with a new attack called Parabolic Charge that heals itself.

character.name: Gogoat
character.description: Gogoat, the Mount Pokémon, is a goat-like Pokémon that the player is able to ride like a horse due to its size. It forms a bond with its trainer when its horns are held.

character.name: Onvern (Pansy)
character.description: Alexa`s Noivern was revealed when it was sent out to protect her from a bunch of Ghost Pokémon.

character.name: Harimaron
character.description: Chespin (ハリマロン), known as the Spiny Nut Pokémon, is a Grass-type and one of the three Pokémon available to players at the start of the game. Described as having a curious nature, it resembles a rodent that has a chestnut-like shell on its head which protects it in battle.

character.name: Fokko
character.description: Fennekin (フォッコ) is the Fox Pokémon, and is the Fire-type starter Pokémon. It is described as being temperamental and it enjoys eating twigs.

character.name: Horubee
character.description: Bunnelby (ホルビー), the rabbit-like Digging Pokémon, is stated to have ears strong enough to break through tree roots. It also possesses the new Cheek Pouch ability and it is noted to use the attack Dig.

character.name: Keromatsu
character.description: Froakie (ケロマツ), the Bubble Frog Pokémon, is the Water-type starter Pokémon. The ruff around its neck is actually made of bubbles which it uses to protect itself from attacks. In the anime, Ash Ketchum meets Froakie during his first day in the Kalos Region who becomes one of his first Pokémon in the region.

character.name: Yayakoma
character.description: Fletchling (ヤヤコマ), the Tiny Robin Pokémon, is said to be friendly and is popular among many trainers. It knows the attack Flame Charge, hinting at its future evolutionary form.

character.name: Trimmien
character.description: Furfrou (トリミアン) is a poodle Pokémon, and its Fur Coat (ファーコート) Ability both protects it and can be modified by the trainer by taking it to a groomer.

character.name: Kofukimushi
character.description: Scatterbug (コフキムシ), the Scatterdust Pokémon, is a caterpillar Pokémon that hides in the forest from flying Pokémon. The fur around its neck has a dust that it uses to adjust its temperature, allowing Scatterbug to live in any environment.

character.name: Vivillon
character.description: Vivillon (ビビヨン), the Scale Pokémon, is a butterfly-like Pokémon that has a colorful pattern on its wings that it flaps to release its scales. Depending on the part of the world the player lives in, he or she will encounter Vivillon with a particular pattern in their game, with players living in other parts of the world receiving entirely different patterns.

character.name: Kofurai
character.description: Spewpa (コフーライ), the Scatterdust Pokémon, is a pupal form of Scatterbug that is the middle stage on its evolution into Vivillon. It has grown more hair around its body which is hard enough to repel attacks and can be straightened into sharp spikes to deter attackers.

character.name: Meehcru
character.description: Skiddo (メェークル), the Mount Pokémon, later evolves into Gogoat. It said that it has lived alongside humans for so long that it does not mind carrying people. Like Gogoat, the player character will be able to ride one at some point in the game.

character.name: Goronda
character.description: Pangoro (ゴロンダ), the Daunting Pokémon, is the evolved form of the panda Pokémon Pancham, gaining a new Dark-type during the evolution. Pangoro seems violent, but it actually believes in fairness in battle, with its leaf able to predict its opponents moves.

character.name: Yancham
character.description: Pancham (ヤンチャム), the Playful Pokémon, resembles a Giant Panda. It is always seen with a leaf sticking out of its mouth, and it tries to intimidate opponents by glaring at them, but this does not often work.

character.name: Shishiko
character.description: Litleo (シシコ), the Lion Cub Pokémon, is hot blooded and always ready to battle. When it fights a strong opponent, Litleo`s red mane burns brightly.

character.name: Flabebe
character.description: Flabébé (フラベベ), the Single Bloom Pokémon, is one of the new Fairy-type Pokémon. When it is born, it finds a flower that it lives on for the rest of its life and gains power from in battle. This flower is different depending on where any particular Flabébé is found.

character.name: Floette
character.description: Floette (フラエッテ) is the evolution of Flabébé. It keeps the same color flower as it had when it evolves. Its Flower Veil ability helps friendly Grass-type Pokémon.

character.name: Horuudo
character.description: Diggersby (ホルード) is the Digging Pokémon and it uses its large ears as shovels to dig through the ground. Its ears are so strong that it can lift heavy stones, and it is often used in construction work.

character.name: Nyasper
character.description: Espurr (ニャスパー) is the "Restraint" Pokémon, so named because it keeps its psychic powers under control by holding its ears shut. Espurr prefer to be independent, and moves and acts at its own pace. It evolves into Meowstic.

character.name: Nyaonix
character.description: Meowstic (ニャオニクス) is a cat Pokémon that has different male and female forms that not only differ in appearance but also differ in moves and Abilities.

character.name: Shushup
character.description: Spritzee (シュシュプ), the Perfumed Pokémon, is a Fairy-type Pokémon that can only be caught in the Y version. In the past it was kept by women for its perfume which it uses to entrance its opponents. This fragrance changes depending on what Spritzee has eaten.

character.name: Hitotsuki
character.description: Honedge (ヒトツキ), the Sword Pokémon, is a ghost that has possessed an ancient sword. It uses the blue tassel on its hilt as a hand and holds its own sheath in battle. It should be noted that Steel type Pokémon are no longer resistant to damage from Dark-type attacks, making this Pokémon and its evolutions vulnerable to Dark-type attacks such as Bite and Dark Pulse as well as Fire-type and Ground-type strikes (Fighting type moves have no effect as it is a Ghost-type).

character.name: Gachigoras
character.description: Tyrantrum (ガチゴラス) is the evolved form of Tyrunt. One hundred million years in the past it was invincible, and its powerful jaws could render an iron plate as if it was made out of paper.

character.name: Peroppuff
character.description: Swirlix (ペロッパフ), the Cotton Candy Pokémon, is a Fairy-type Pokémon that can only be found in the X version. It loves candy and sweets so much that its fur resembles cotton candy in appearance and texture, using its stickiness to its advantage in battles.

character.name: Calamanero
character.description: Malamar (カラマネロ), the Overturning Pokémon, is the evolved form of Inkay. It is said to be the best hypnotist of all Pokémon, and for this reason many ill-intentioned trainers seek out this Pokémon.

character.name: Maaiika
character.description: Inkay (マーイーカ), the Revolving Pokémon, resembles a squid. It can drain other Pokémon`s powers by flashing lights above its eyes, and it uses these to communicate with friends. Inkay has a new move called Topsy-turvy that changes its opponents stats. During battle, Inkay will change its vertical orientation often.

character.name: Kuzumo
character.description: Skrelp (クズモー), the Mock Kelp Pokémon, is inspired by the weedy seadragons. It hides by resembling a piece of rotting kelp, and uses its poison to ambush prey. Skrelp can only be caught in the Y version of the games.

character.name: Dramidoro
character.description: Dragalge (ドラミドロ) is the evolved form of Skrelp, gaining the Dragon Type in the evolution. It guards its home fiercely, and many fear Dragalge for this reason.

character.name: Elezard
character.description: Heliolisk (エレザード) is the evolved form of Helioptile. A single Heliolisk can generate enough electricity to power a high-rise building as it takes in solar energy with the large frill around its neck.

character.name: Chigoras
character.description: Tyrunt (チゴラス) is a fossil Pokémon resembling a Tyrannosaur. It uses its powerful jaws in battle, and its Ability Strong Jaw increases its bite move powers.

character.name: Amarus
character.description: Amaura (アマルス) is another fossil Pokémon, this one resembling a Sauropod. Its icy powers are further improved with its Refrigerate Ability which turns its Normal moves into Ice moves.

character.name: Nymphia
character.description: Sylveon (ニンフィア), the Intertwining Pokémon, is a Fairy type Pokémon and a brand new evolution of the first generation Pokémon Eevee. Its type was kept a mystery until the official reveal. Sylveon possesses abilities to move its antenna-like ribbons on its body which uses it to relieve the feelings of both humans and Pokémon. Also the ribbons act as a leash when it walks with its trainer. Sylveon can learn a new Fairy-type move, Moonblast, that allows it to borrow energy from the moon and attack the opponent with a powerful blast. Sylveon appears in the short feature Pikachu and Eevee Friends that accompanies the film Pokémon the Movie: Genesect and the Legend Awakened in theaters, wherein it is voiced by Shoko Nakagawa.

character.name: Amaruruga
character.description: Aurorus (アマルルガ) is the evolved form of Amaura. It can use ice as cold as -150 °C to attack using the new Freeze-Dry move or to defend itself by forming a wall of ice in front of itself.

character.name: Dedenne
character.description: Dedenne (デデンネ), the hamster-like Antenna Pokémon, is stated to be able to use its whiskers to communicate with far off allies and recharge itself by plugging its tail into electrical outlets. It has a new ability called Cheek Pouch that allows it to benefit in two different ways from Berries and a new attack called Nuzzle.

character.name: Zygarde
character.description: Zygarde (ジガルデ) is also known as the Order Pokémon and its body somewhat resembles the letter Z. It is a mythical Pokémon said to appear only when disorder strikes the Kalos region`s environment. Its ability Aura Break reverses the effects of Xerneas and Yveltal`s abilities.

character.name: Numera
character.description: Goomy (ヌメラ) is the anemone-like Soft Tissue Pokémon. Said to be the weakest of Dragon Types, it lives in damp and shady places. This way its body does not dry out.

character.name: Bokurey
character.description: Phantump (ボクレー) is also known as the Stump Pokémon: it is Trevenant`s pre evolved form. It is born when a spirit possesses a rotten tree stump. It can use the new move Forest`s Curse to add the Grass Type to an opposing Pokémon.

character.name: Bakeccha
character.description: Pumpkaboo (バケッチャ), the Pumpkin Pokémon, is born when the souls of the dead cannot pass onto the otheride, and instead inhabit pumpkins. Pumpkaboo can be found in many sizes, with the largest being twice as big as the smallest.

character.name: Onbat
character.description: Noibat (オンバット) is the child form of Noivern. Its ears produce ultrasonic waves that allow it to communicate with others and hunt its prey. It can even use the waves to determine if fruit is ripe enough to eat.

character.name: Xerneas
character.description: Xerneas is a Fairy-type Legendary Pokémon introduced in Generation VI. It is not known to evolve into or from any other Pokémon. Along with Chespin, Fennekin, Froakie, and Yveltal, it was the first Generation VI Pokémon to be revealed to the public on January 8, 2013 as part of the Pokémon Direct broadcast. Xerneas is the game mascot of Pokémon X, appearing on the boxart. It is a member of the aura trio with Yveltal and Zygarde. Xerneas is a quadruped, stag-like Pokémon with four pairs of antlers. Its coloration varies slightly depending on which mode it is in: Active Mode or Neutral Mode. Regardless of mode, its main body is always black with a blue stripe down its back and a short, bushy tail. Starting at its knees there is a blade-like trim around each leg, which forms a point under each hoof. There is an upside-down, V-shaped marking on its chest in the same color as the trim on its legs. Its head and neck are blue, and there are two large, tufts that extend onto its chest and curve upward. Its first pair of antlers extends onto its head and curves around the underside of its eyes. The eyes are black with X-shaped pupils. There is a short marking on top of its snout and an upward curving horn on each side of its head in place of ears. In Active Mode, its markings, antlers, and the trim on its legs is pale gold. Its antlers have branches and bumps in many colors and there are multicolored spots on its back. In Neutral Mode, its marking and antlers are instead pale blue and the embellishments on its antlers and spots on its back are a darker blue. Xerneas has the power to share eternal life. This occurs when the horns on its head shine in seven colors. As seen in the anime, if it expends too much life energy it transforms into a tree and sleeps for 1,000 years. Xerneas is the only known Pokémon capable of learning the move Geomancy.

character.name: Oarot
character.description: Trevenant (オーロット) is a tree-like Pokémon possessing multiple root-like legs and one eye that was first briefly featured in a commercial for Pokémon X and Y shown at screenings of ExtremeSpeed Genesect: Mewtwo Awakens in Japan, which was later shown on the eShop and uploaded to Pokémon Japan`s official YouTube channel.

character.name: Serena
character.description: Serena is a young girl who is just starting on her journey as a Pokémon trainer in the Kalos region. She appears to have met http://anidb.net/ch6693 [Satoshi] before.

character.name: Eureka
character.description: Eureka is Citron`s younger sister. She met Ash in Niare City and she and her brother were his very first battle opponents in the Kalos region, a battle he won`t forget soon. Eureka is a girl of strong character, who`s always searching for a future wife for her brother. Since she`s not a Pokémon Trainer yet, but she gets Citron to "keep" Pokémon for her. She was confirmed to be in the XY anime in Smash #153. Eureka`s Japanese name origin is from the lily family which is "Yuri-ka" in Japanese

character.name: Citron
character.description: Citron is Eureka`s older brother. He met Ash in Niare City and he and his sister were his very first battle opponents in the Kalos region, a battle he won`t forget soon. He`s a great inventor, a gym leader and carries his pride and joy, the "Eipam Arm" in his backpack. Eureka is always searching for a future wife for her brother. Since she`s not a Pokémon Trainer, she gets Citron to "keep" Pokémon for her. Citron was confirmed to be in the XY anime in Smash #153. His Japanese name is based off of the fragrant citrus fruit with the same name.

character.name: Viola
character.description: Viola is an active woman with a nice body and a great waist. She is the Gym Leader of Santalune City Gym (Hakudan City). Battling trainers isn`t her only talent as she is also a professional Pokémon photographer.

character.name: Serena no Okaasan
character.description: Grace is Serena`s mom. She is a Sihorn racer who lives is in the Kalos region. Her name in the Japanese games is Saki (サキ) but has not been confirmed in the anime.

character.name: Sihorn (Serena no Okaasan)
character.description: Grace`s Rhyhorn lives with Grace at her house in the Kalos region. They participated together in Sihorn races. Serena has been practicing with Grace`s Rhyhorn to learn how to ride and race.

character.name: Yayakoma (Serena no Okaasan)
character.description: Grace`s Fletchling lives with Grace at her house in the Kalos region. It`s often used as an alarm clock to wake up Serena. It is also often seen watching Grace and Serena do chores and practice Sihorn races.

character.name: Platane-hakase
character.description: Professor Sycamore is a a Pokémon Professor who has a laboratory in Lumiose City of the Kalos region. He gives out Froakie, Chespin or Fennekin to beginning trainers. His name Platane in Japanese originates from the Platanus genus.

character.name: Keromatsu (Satoshi)
character.description: Ash`s Froakie contacted Professor Sycamore laboratory to let them know he wanted to give up Froakie. The staff at the lab had been worried about Froakie. This particular Froakie is a bit different to the other ones the professor had given out. It refused to listen to its trainers during battle, it ran away from a trainer simply because it didn`t like its trainer and several trainers have returned it to Professor Sycamore lab. Froakie though took a liking to Ash and it came to the rescue when Team Rocket was trying to steal Pikachu. It also accompanied Ash up the Prism Tower when they went after Garchomp. Finally, as Ash was leaving the lab, Froakie appeared with its Poké Ball, indicating that it wanted to travel with him. Ash agreed and he caught Froakie.

character.name: Dedenne (Citron)
character.description: Clemont`s Dedenne appeared in a forest outside of Lumiose City. As soon as Bonnie saw it she thought it was cute and wanted to keep it but because she wasn`t a Pokémon Trainer, she tried to convince her brother to capture it for her. Bonnie noted that it wasn`t afraid of humans and it got along with Pikachu quickly since they`re both Electric types and they communicated with electricity. Clemont initial attempt to capture it was not successful though. A few days later though, the same Dedenne reappeared as it had been following them the whole time they had been traveling. This time though Clemont was successful in capturing it. It really seems to like the Pokémon food that Clemont and Bonnie give it.

character.name: Horubee (Citron)
character.description: Clemont`s Bunnelby battled against Pikachu in its very first battle as Clemont as its trainer. He told it to just relax and it would do great. Their battle was cut short as Team Rocket interfered.

character.name: Limone
character.description: Limone is the father of Clemont and Bonnie. He lives in Lumiose City where he runs an electric appliance store in this city together with Denryu. He seems to know a lot about electric devices and Electric Pokémon. He`s told Clemont many times that being strict to challengers as a Gym Leader is fine but strictness alone won`t make them become good Trainers. He`s told his son that as the Gym Leader of the Lumiose City Gym, he is the pride of their city. Initially, little was known about this masked person that dresses up like Burshamo, but he does try to help the citizens of Lumiose City. Blaziken Mask tries to keep his identity unknown to the general population and often goes out at night like a super hero to help our around the city.

character.name: Bursyamo (Bursyamo Kamen)
character.description: Blaziken Mask`s Blaziken was first seen by Ash at the Lumiose City airport when it jumped over him. It later came to his and Pikachu`s rescue after he jumped off the Prism Tower. It has also been seen in its mega evolved form.

character.name: Gablias (Platane-hakase)
character.description: Professor Sycamore`s Garchomp resides at Professor Sycamore`s lab in Lumiose City. Team Rocket infiltrated the lab and used a device on it to control it so they could figure out how to make it Mega Evolve. Unfortunately it went wrong and Professor Sycamore`s Garchomp went into a rage throughout the city. Ash went after it and followed it up the Prism Tower. With the help of Ash`s Froakie, Ash and Pikachu were able to break the collar that Team Rocket put on Professor Sycamore`s Garchomp. Despite being fatigued, Professor Sycamore`s Garchomp fully recovered from the incident.

character.name: Junsaa
character.description: Officer Jenny is the local law enforcement leader in the Kalos region. Each city and area has a Jenny who looks exactly the same as she does elsewhere in the Kalos region though they do look different compared to their Jenny counterparts elsewhere in the Pokémon World. The most noticeable different between Kalos region Jenny and those from elsewhere in the Pokémon World is their haircut.

character.name: Joy
character.description: Nurse Joy in the Kalos region looks a little different than she does in the other regions in the Pokémon World. Her duties are to take care of injured Pokémon as they arrive at the Pokémon Center. She is a trained nurse and with the help of her Wigglytuff she is able to nurse the Pokémon back to health. Like the other regions in the Pokémon World, the Nurse Joy of the Kalos region have many sisters. The only real way to differentiate between them when next to each other is to look at the color of the badge on their outfits.

character.name: Pukurin (Joy)
character.description: Nurse Joy`s Wigglytuff helps Joy around the Pokémon Center caring for injured Pokémon. It also does odd jobs that need to be done around the Center such as getting badge cases for trainers.

character.name: Sophie
character.description: Sophie is one of Professor Sycamore assistants who works at his lab. She confronted Team Rocket when they tried to pose as scientific service people. She was also seen presenting the Starter Pokémon to Serena.

character.name: Cosette
character.description: Cosette is one of Professor Sycamore assistants who works at his lab. She confronted Team Rocket when they tried to pose as scientific service people.

character.name: Maaiika (Kojirou)
character.description: James` Inkay was first spotted in Miare City when it ate James` croissant. It seemed to like the food that he was eating and it followed them on their journey. When they stopped to eat lunch, it appeared again and this time it ate his sandwich. In a quick battle with Wobbuffet, Inkay squirted ink all over its face. James then lured it with more sandwiches and then caught it with a monster ball. James` Inkay often uses an ink squirting attack during battles but its not an actual move.

character.name: Yayakoma (Satoshi)
character.description: Ash`s Fletchling was spotted in the Route 4 forest when it stole the Pokémon food that Bonnie was trying to feed to Clemont`s Dedenne. Ash noted that the Fletchling was fast and that he wanted to catch it after seeing it move so quickly. Initially, Ash`s Froakie wanted to battle but Ash told it not to be reckless and to let Pikachu handle the battle. Ash`s Froakie wanted to punish Yayakoma because Bonnie was looking so sad after trying to feed Dedenne. After working on a strategy, they picked a rocky area where Ash`s Froakie could combine the differences in elevation with Ash`s Froakie jumping power to achieve even higher levels of mobility to counter Fletchling flying speed. After an intense battle, Ash captured Fletchling and the two of them agreed to be friends from that day on. Bonnie forgave Ash`s Fletchling for stealing the food but gave it an Oran Berry as a sign of reconciliation.

character.name: Fokko (Serena)
character.description: Serena`s Fennekin was the Pokémon that Serena chose as her starter Pokémon at Professor Sycamore lab. Serena thought that after seeing all the starter Pokémon for real that they were all cute but she had already decided before she left home that she would get a Fennekin.

character.name: Vivillon (Viola)
character.description: Viola`s Vivillon is her pride as a Gym Leader and the Pokémon she often counts on during gym battles. It was the second Pokémon that Viola sent out to battle against Ash in both their battles. In the first round, Ash`s Fletchling was defeated by Viola`s Vivillon after it got caught in the Sticky Web from earlier in the battle and couldn`t break free when Vivillon`s SolarBeam hit it. Realizing that he needed to train his Pokémon some more, Ash`s Fletchling was able to learn from the training in the rematch battle and ride the wind better but it was still defeated by Viola`s Vivillon. Pikachu though still had damage left from its fight against Ametama but it overcame that and was able to wake up from Sleep Powder by using Electro Ball on itself. With ice on its wing, Viola`s Vivillon started moving strangely giving Pikachu the opportunity to knock it out with Thunderbolt to win the rematch gym battle.

character.name: Ametama (Viola)
character.description: Viola`s Surskit was matched up against Pikachu in Ash`s first gym match against Viola. Clemont thought that against a Bug/Water type like Ametama, Electric types have the advantage by far. Viola`s Surskit though used Ice Beam on the field and it was able skate around fast. Pikachu had a hard time keeping its balance and was then knocked out by Viola`s Surskit`s Signal Beam. In the rematch battle, the field was iced again but this time Pikachu stabilized itself by stabbing its tail into the ground. A quick Thunderbolt hit Viola`s Surskit and knocked it out.

character.name: Ishizuka
character.description: Ishizuka is a Sihorn racer who wore the number 5 in a race at the Smillville track. He was seen racing twice, once when Ash and his friends first arrived and then in the race that Ash participated in. During the race with Ash, Ishizuka was attacked and captured by Team Rocket so they could steal the racers Rihorn`s. He was later let go by Ash and his friends.

character.name: Jessica
character.description: Jessica is a Pokémon Groomer in training. She had a Trimmien that she would like to cut and coif but it initially wouldn`t let her. Trimmien are very intelligent and can recognize the Trainer`s nature; if they don`t approve, they won`t listen to them. At the time it didn`t trust Jessica, it ran off an accidentally hit Bonnie causing her to get scraped. As an apology for getting Bonnie hurt, Jessica invited Ash and his friends to her masters shop. After gaining some confidence from an encounter with Rocket Gang, Jessica and her Trimmien began to work together and trust each other. From now on, Jessica vowed to trust her Trimmien much more, gain lots and lots of experience and become a Star Groomer someday.Serena asked to get her Fokko groomed when that happened.

character.name: Barry
character.description: Barry is a Star Groomer who is featured in a guidebook that Serena happened to have. Ash and his friends visited the shop that he was working in as part of an apology by his pupil Jessica.

character.name: Trimmien (Jessica)
character.description: Jessica`s Furfrou initially wouldn`t let her cut and coif it. Trimmien are very intelligent and can recognize the Trainer`s nature; if they don`t approve, they won`t listen to them. At the time it didn`t trust Jessica, it ran off an accidentally hit Bonnie causing her to get scraped. As an apology for getting Bonnie hurt, Jessica invited Ash and his friends to her masters shop. After gaining some confidence from an encounter with Rocket Gang, Jessica and her Trimmien began to work together and trust each other. From now on, Jessica vowed to trust her Trimmien much more, gain lots and lots of experience.

character.name: Livolt (Junsaa)
character.description: Officer Jenny`s Manectric is often seen accompanying Officer Jenny throughout the Kalos region.

character.name: Denryu (Limone)
character.description: Limone`s Ampharos helps Limone run an electric appliance store in Lumiose City.

character.name: Citroid
character.description: The Citroid is an artificial life form created by Clemont. Clemont was so busy as a Gym Leader that he barely had any time for my beloved inventions. That`s when he got the idea of making a capable Gym Leader Robot that could help him with his Gym matches. It is currently the interim Gym Leader of the Lumiose Gym. The name Citroid is a combination of Citron and Android. Clemont initially incorporated his image of an ideal Gym Leader into the AI but it later proved to be too strict as it required challengers to have at least 4 gym badges. Clemont did a few tweaks to change its software to give it a more modest attitude, that the number of badges a Trainer has is irrelevant, added kindness to its strictness, to never forget to give advice to the challenger after the battle and finally compassion. It has a Master Recognition Battle mode which requires an voice activation code in order to initiate the mode. During the initial setup, the Citroid was damaged and instead of Clemont having the code set as "Croquette" it set the password as "Please bear with me from today on. I`m Citron, the Gym Leader!". This caused Clemont a lot of problems as he couldn`t initiate the Master Recognition Battle mode properly. He finally figured out what happened as was able to initiate the code to do the battle to prove that he was Clemont.

character.name: Coil (Citron)
character.description: Clemont`s Magnemite attacked Clemont and his friends when they entered the gym because at the time the Citroid was the owner of the gym and it had orders to get rid of intruders. Clemont`s Magnemite did recognize Clemont though and smiled but still attacked. It does know an electric attack but which move it is was not confirmed in the episode dialog.

character.name: Rarecoil (Citron)
character.description: Clemont`s Magneton attacked Clemont and his friends when they entered the gym because at the time the Citroid was the owner of the gym and it had orders to get rid of intruders. It does know an electric attack and a sonic like attack but which moves they are were not confirmed in the episode dialog.

character.name: Elezard (Citron)
character.description: Clemont`s Heliolisk resides at the Lumiose Gym where it battles Trainers under the direction of the Citroid. It seemed very happy to see Clemont when he returned to the gym. During the Master Recognition Battle mode, Clemont told Heliolisk to come at him with all its might. It learned new battle techniques and moves from the direction of the Citroid but Clemont was able to defeat his Heliolisk to prove to the Citroid that he was the master.

character.name: Harimaron (Citron)
character.description: Clemont`s Chespin was initially one of the three Pokémon a Trainer receives from Professor Sycamore when they start out on their journey. It took the basket of macarons that Serena had baked the night before and began stuffing itself and didn`t want to share them. Sophie noted that Harimaron loves pranks. Team Rocket captured Professor Sycamore, Serena and Bonnie but Harimaron was able to follow a macaron crumb trail to their hideout. It was initially more concerned about getting the macarons back but it finally realized that Team Rocket was also a threat, so it helped out and manged to stop the Mega Mega Nyarth mecha. During its time with Clemont in the crisis situation, the two began to bond and just as Clemont was leaving Professor Sycamore lab, it indicated that it wanted to travel with Clemont. Professor Sycamore gave Clemont Harimaron`s monster ball and he got it.

character.name: Bakeccha (Musashi)
character.description: While walking on Route 5, Jessie tripped over Pumpkaboo horns. It then emerged from underground and put on its lights on. Jessie then randomly threw a Monster Ball at it and got it to the surprise of her teammates.

character.name: Daz
character.description: Daz is a Pokémon Merchant who captures Pokémon from various regions for Pokémon Collectors all over the world and sell them out on a large scale on the Internet. Daz places transmitting devices on his captured Pokémon so he can follow them if they escape. With help from Ash, Officer Jenny managed to arrest Daz and they let all the captured Pokémon go.

character.name: Horuudo (Daz)
character.description: Daz`s Diggersby is Daz`s only known Pokémon that he personally has ownership of. It helps Daz with his Pokémon Merchant activities. It was defeated in a battle with Ash`s Froakie and Vivillon who had been captured as a Spewpa by Daz.

character.name: Premiere
character.description: Première is a teacher at a kindergarten in the Kalos region near Shoyo City. She appears to be at least 18 years old as she has a drivers license and access to a car. She met Ash and his friends by coincidence while they were on their way to Shoyo City and her eyes met Ash and as per the Trainers rule, they had a Pokémon battle. She added the stipulation though that if she won the battle, he`d have to be with her for a while. Serena mistook that as a romantic advance though. Ash lost the battle and he agreed to be with her for awhile. She took him to her school where he showcased his Pokémon to the children there. Première and Nymphia go out to the forest or the meadows every day and bring back wild Pokémon they`ve befriended to show the children so they can interact with Pokémon.

character.name: Nymphia (Premiere)
character.description: Première`s Sylveon battled against Ash`s Froakie. Ash had never battled against a Fairy type Pokémon before but he was enthusiastic nonetheless. The battle ended after Ash`s Froakie became infatuated with Première`s Sylveon due to the Moonblast / Draining Kiss combo. Première and Nymphia go out to the forest or the meadows every day and bring back wild Pokémon they`ve befriended to show the children so they can interact with Pokémon. Première`s Sylveon was captured along with Pikachu but with Ash`s help, they were set free and it was returned to Première.

character.name: Lundi
character.description: Lundi is a child that goes to the kindergarten in the Kalos near Shoyo City where Première is a teacher at. His name in the Japanese version is based of the French word for Monday (lundi). He was afraid that the Pokémon that Première would bring to the school would hurt him, so he decided to avoid them. He had an encounter with some Pokémon that frightened him. It wasn`t until he became friends with Ash`s Froakie that he was no longer afraid of Pokémon. He helped rescue Pikachu and Première`s Sylveon after they were stolen by Rocket Gang.

character.name: Lisa
character.description: Lisa was a grandmother who used to play with her grandchildren in her mansion located near Shoyo City in the Kalos region. Her granddaughter Ellie was one of the kids that came to visit her. Ellie confirmed to Nyasper that Lisa had died and was the reason she was no longer at the mansion. Just before she died, Lisa befriended a Nyasper and gave it a pendant she often wore. She played with Nyasper and gave it food as well. Nyasper returned one day to give the pendant back but Lisa wasn`t there. Nyasper decided to wait until she returned. It wasn`t until Ellie arrived to do renovations of the mansion that it realized what had happened. Ellie thought that the pendant looked good on Nyasper and she told it to keep it.

character.name: Ellie
character.description: Ellie is the granddaughter of Lisa. She used to play with her at her grandma`s mansion located near Shoyo City in the Kalos region. Ellie confirmed to Nyasper that Lisa had died and was the reason she was no longer at the mansion. Just before she died, Lisa befriended a Nyasper and gave it a pendant she often wore. She played with Nyasper and gave it food as well. Nyasper returned one day to give the pendant back but Lisa wasn`t there. Nyasper decided to wait until she returned. It wasn`t until Ellie arrived to do renovations of the mansion that it realized what had happened. Ellie thought that the pendant looked good on Nyasper and she told it to keep it. Ellie took Nyasper with her in her car to visit the grave of her grandma.

character.name: Ojiisan
character.description: The old man from Kalos lives with his wife. He won the tournament at the Village Festival. His wife had been battling with him for a long time but the day before Clemont and his friends met him, the two of them had got into an argument and neither wanted to apologize. Wanting to knock her husband down a peg, she agreed to battle him with her secret weapon, Clemont`s Chespin in a Pokémon battle. The old man agreed but with the stipulation that she would forgive him for what he said the day before. Clemont`s Chespin was too fat to battle though as it had been eating too many macarons. Clemont ended up intervening and got it to roll to reduce its belly fat. The match had to be called as the old man`s back gave out as he was trying to command Mafoxy to use Mystical Fire. The old man returned to his house and had bought his wife a cake as make-up gift. He had planned to apologize, no matter if he won or lost the Pokémon battle between them.

character.name: Obaasan
character.description: The old woman from Kalos lives with her husband near Shoyo City. She enjoys cooking, especially macarons. Her husband had been battling with her for a long time but the day before Clemont and his friends met him, the two of them had got into an argument and neither wanted to apologize. Clemont`s Chespin could smell the macarons she was cooking that day and quickly followed the smell to her house. The two of them became friends quickly. Wanting to knock her husbands down a peg, she agreed to battle him with her secret weapon, Clemont`s Chespin in a Pokémon battle. The old man agreed but with the stipulation that she would forgive him for what he said the day before. Clemont`s Chespin was too fat to battle though as it had been eating too many macarons. Clemont ended up intervening and got it to rull to reduce its belly fat. The match had to be called as the old man`s back gave out as he was trying to command Mafoxy to use Mystical Fire. The old man returned to his house and had bought his wife a cake as make-up gift. He had planned to apologize, no matter if he won or lost the Pokémon battle between them.

character.name: Mafoxy (Ojiisan)
character.description: Old Man`s Delphox seems to be the Old Man`s main Pokémon. The Old Man won the tournament at the Village Festival near Shoyo City. Wanting to knock her husbands down a peg and to get him to apologize for the fight they had the day before, she agreed to battle Old Man`s Delphox with her secret weapon, Clemont`s Chespin in a Pokémon battle. The old man agreed but with the stipulation that she would forgive him for what he said the day before. Clemont`s Chespin was too fat to battle though as it had been eating too many macarons. Clemont ended up intervening and got it to roll to reduce its belly fat. The match had to be called as the old man`s back gave out as he was trying to command Mafoxy to use Mystical Fire.

character.name: Lenna
character.description: Lena is a Pokémon Trainer traveling in the Kalos region. Bonnie randomly walked up to Lena at a Pokémon Center near Shoyo City and asked her to marry her brother Clemont. While talking to an acquaintance, her younger sister Lyn went looking for Pichu who was in a pochette that got mixed up with Bonnie`s pochette at the Pokémon Center. Lyn feared her sister Lena would be mad. Lena went searching for Lyn and her Pichu after she realized she wasn`t with her anymore. They were reunited with the help of Clemont and his friends who were also looking for Lyn and Lena. Both the Pokémon were returned to their owners. She then had a meal with Ash and his friends.

character.name: Lim
character.description: Lyn is the younger sister of Lena. Bonnie randomly walked up to Lena at a Pokémon Center near Shoyo City and asked her to marry her brother Clemont. Lyn found the situation amusing. Pichu who was in a pochette that got mixed up with Bonnie`s pochette at the Pokémon Center. Lyn feared her sister Lena would be mad. Lena went searching for Lyn and her Pichu after she realized she wasn`t with her anymore. They were reunited with the help of Clemont and his friends who were also looking for Lyn and Lena. Both the Pokémon were returned to their owners. She then had a meal with Ash and his friends.

character.name: Pichu (Lenna)
character.description: Lenna`s Pichu is often seen outside of its Poké Ball, resting in Lim`s pochette. Lenna entrusted Pichu to her yougner sister Lim. While talking to an acquaintance, her younger sister Lim went looking for Pichu who was in a pochette that got mixed up with Bonnie`s pochette at the Pokémon Center. Lim feared her sister Lenna would be mad. Pichu was reunited with the help of Clemont and his friends who were also looking for Lim and Lenna.

character.name: Sanpei
character.description: Sanpei is a ninja boy that knows the Ninja art of leaf concealment. He lives in the Ninja Village and likes to train alongside his Pokémon. He speaks in a pseudo-archaic manner. He has two brothers that live in the village: his eldest brother and strongest combatant of the ninja village, with his Gekkouga and the number two of the ninja village, his brother Nihei and Fushigibana. Sanpei was watching Ash`s Froakie train in a forest near Shoyo City when he revealed himself camouflaged in front of a tree. His training showed Ash how helpful it could be when he defeated Ash`s Froakie in a battle. Clemont commented that he`d never seen a Quick Attack like the one Sanpei`s Frogadier was able to do. Sanpei is quite proud of the attack as no one gets up after the attack which is very fast and powerful. Despite being rivals on the battlefield, Sanpei was friendly enough to help Ash`s Froakie learn Quick Attack at the request of Ash although the training ended up that it learned Double Team. After an encounter with Team Rocket, Sanpei gained new found respect for Ash and the two of them vowed to have another battle if they met again.

character.name: Gekogashira (Sanpei)
character.description: Sanpei`s Frogadier is Sanpei`s main Pokémon. It lives in the Ninja Village with Sanpei and likes to train alongside him. Sanpei`s Frogadier defeated Ash`s Froakie in a battle as its speed and power proved to be the deciding factor. Clemont commented that he`d never seen a Quick Attack like the one Sanpei`s Frogadier was able to do. Sanpei is quite proud of the attack as no one gets up after the attack which is very fast and powerful. Despite being rivals on the battlefield, Sanpei was friendly enough to help Ash`s Froakie learn Quick Attack at the request of Ash. Sanpei`s Frogadier trained and showed Ash`s Froakie how it was able to do the move. Although the training ended up that Ash`s Froakie learned Double Team.

character.name: Ippei
character.description: Ippei is Sanpei`s eldest brother and strongest combatant of the ninja village. He has a Gekkouga.

character.name: Gekkouga (Ippei)
character.description: Ippei`s Greninja is Ippei`s main Pokémon and strongest combatant of the ninja village.

character.name: Nihei
character.description: Nihei is Sanpei`s brother, the number two of the ninja village. He has a Fushigibana.

character.name: Fushigibana (Nihei)
character.description: Nihei`s Venusaur is Nihei`s main Pokémon that lives in the ninja village.

character.name: Princess Ally
character.description: Princess Ally of the Parfum Palace is a spoiled brat that always tries to get her way. She visited Lord Shabboneau and took his heirloom Pokémon Flute. He didn`t protest as he owed a lot to Princess Ally`s father. Ash and his friends confronted Princess Ally at the Parfum Palace to return the Pokémon Flute but she stubbornly refused. She took a liking to Pikachu and offered Ash gold and jewels in exchange for it, but he refused. She then offered to battle Pikachu for the Flute to which an angry Ash and Pikachu agreed to. Pikachu won the match against Princess Ally`s Furfrou but she tricked them as she said the flute was only the consolation prize. Princess Ally then got a crush on Clemont after he stood up to her and began yelling at her and told her she wouldn`t have any friends if she kept being so selfish. She took his scolding as a sign that he liked her, which wasn`t the case. Bonnie agreed to allow Princess Ally to keep him in exchange for the Pokémon Flute. Clemont stayed at the palace until he created an android version of himself while he escaped.

character.name: Trimmien (Princess Ally)
character.description: Princess Ally`s Furfrou caught Ash and his friends in the courtyard of Parfum Palace. When Princess Ally took a liking to Pikachu, she offered to battle Pikachu for the Flute to which an angry Ash and Pikachu agreed to. Pikachu won the match against Princess Ally`s Furfrou as Princess Ally forfeit the match because it wasn`t looking beautiful after a Thunderbolt wrecked its hair.

character.name: Shabboneau
character.description: Lord Shabboneau resides at Shabboneau Castle in the Kalos region. He is indebted to Princess Ally`s father. Every year, once a Kabigon from the mountains has eaten all the roots, a festival with prayers for a good harvest takes place out of gratitude. At the climax of the festival, when the sound of the Pokémon Flute the lord of Shabboneau Castle plays reverberates on the plaza, Kabigon returns to the mountains while eating our offerings and dancing. Lord Shabboneau lost possession of the Pokémon Flute the year that Ash and his friends were in the village. He kept lying to people by saying he had a recorder allergy that gives him hives when he plays the flute and that he developed a recorder phobia. It was infact Princess Ally from the Parfum Palace of the neighboring village who came for a visit and thought the flute was so cute and took it with her. Lord Shabboneau didn`t protest as he owed a lot to her father and didn`t want to offend her. With the help of Ash and his friends, they were able to retrieve the flute from Princess Ally so that Lord Shabboneau was able to play it as part of the festival that year.

character.name: Madame X
character.description: Madame X is a Officer Jenny under mind control by the hands of Malamar. Under that influence she takes over Pikachu along with the Team Rocket duo, Meowth however escaped. Throughout the episode it is revealed that more Pokémon were being controlled and followed her instructions of along with Citron, Eureka, and Serena.

character.name: Nikola
character.description: Nikola is a Pokémon Trainer that traveled in the Kalos region with his younger brother Tesla. They are a hip hop duo and speak with a hip-hop dialect which seems to annoy Serena who thought they were rappers. He held the rank of peerage rank of Baron at the Battle Chateau when he first met Ash Ketchum but was granted the title of Viscount after Molly announced that he had defeated ten people.

character.name: Ikkon
character.description: Duke Hennessy is the head of the Battle Chateau house and he greeted Ash Ketchum when he arrived. He runs the Battle Chateau as a social meeting place where he offers first-rate fights to any ladies and gentlemen that train Pokémon. Furthermore, all Trainers are referred to as "knights" and as people advance through an order of sequential titles called "peerage ranks" are awarded according to their battle results.

character.name: Molly
character.description: Molly is a greeting maid and battle referee at the Battle Chateau house and she greeted Ash Ketchum when he arrived. She helps runs the Battle Chateau as a social meeting place where they offer first-rate fights to any ladies and gentlemen that train Pokémon. She guided them through the salon, a place where people choose their opponent.

character.name: Pharrell
character.description: Pharrell is a Pokémon trainer that holds the peerage rank of Baron at the Battle Chateau in the Kalos Region. He accepted Nikola`s challenge to battle. He lost in the battle and since that battle was the 10th win for Nikola, he was elevated from Baron to Viscount.

character.name: Hinoyakoma (Nikola)
character.description: Nikola`s main partner is Hinoyakoma. It is often seen perched on his shoulder outside of its Poké Ball. It battled against Pharrell`s Dusknoir where it proved to be a strong Pokémon as it endured a direct hit from Thunder Punch. It was a quick battle and Nikola`s Fletchinder won the battle against Pharrell`s Dusknoir.

character.name: Tesla
character.description: Tesla is a Pokémon Trainer that traveled in the Kalos region with his older brother Nikola. He had been training with his brother in preparation for his first battle at the Battle Chateau. They are a hip hop duo and speak with a hip-hop dialect which seems to annoy Serena who thought they were rappers. In his debut Battle Chateau match, he faced Ash Ketchum. Unfortuantely for him, Pikachu had a super effective type advantage over Tesla`s Fletchling and also had a lot more battle experience so it wasn`t long until Pikachu was able to defeat it. Ash Ketchum was awarded the title of Baron for winning the match. Tesla was polite and little frustrated but he congratulated Ash Ketchum and looked forward to his next match by vowing to train harder with his brother.

character.name: Yayakoma (Tesla)
character.description: Tesla`s main partner is Fletchling. In his debut Battle Chateau match, it faced Pikachu. Unfortuantely for Tesla`s Fletchling, Pikachu had a super effective type advantage over it and also had a lot more battle experience so it wasn`t long until Pikachu was able to defeat it. Ash Ketchum was awarded the title of Baron for winning the match. Tesla was polite and little frustrated but he congratulated Ash Ketchum and looked forward to his next match by vowing to train harder with his brother.

character.name: Yonoir (Pharrell)
character.description: Pharrell`s Dusknoir battled against Nikola`s Fletchinder where it proved its Ghost type moves were good at avoiding attacks but Nikola`s Fletchinder endured a direct hit from Thunder Punch. It was a quick battle and Nikola`s Fletchinder won the battle against Pharrell`s Dusknoir.

character.name: Zakuro
character.description: Grant is the Gym Leader of the Cyllage Gym located in Cyllage City in the Kalos Region. It is a Rock type gym. He is friends with Viola and the two have battled previously at the Battle Chateau. He held the peerage rank of Duke until he defeated Viola to achieve the rank of Grand Duke. He is an avid climber and loves to climb everything in sight including walls. He particularly likes climbing the wall in the salon at the Battle Chateau and is often seen there. Before leaving the Battle Chateau, he watched Ash Ketchum`s battle against Tesla and he noticed the momentum that Ash Ketchum had in the battle. Viola told Grant that Ash Ketchum has guts and that his passion would get him fired up. Ash Ketchum wanted to raise his rank to battle Grant but he revealed to Ash Ketchum after his battle victory against Viola that he was the Gym Leader of the Cyllage Gym. Grant told him that he was looking forward to the day he`d come to challenge him.

character.name: Iwark (Zakuro)
character.description: Grant`s Onix was first seen battling Viola`s Surskit at the Battle Chateau. Viola noted that its speed and power has increased since last time they battled. That increase proved to be the difference in the battle as it overwhelmed Viola`s Surskit and defeated it. Grant was awarded the title of Grand Duke to which he thanked his Onix for all its hard work and dedicated the victory to it.

character.name: Elle
character.description: Aria in a Idol who is regularly featured in the "Best 10 PokéVisions (ポケビジョン・ベスト10)" and she started off in idol Pokémon unit with her Fokko and they are now immensely popular. Bonnie thought that Serena was in no way inferior to Aria. While on their way to Shoyo City, Ash and his friends stopped at a Pokémon Center and watched PokéVision. The episode they watched featured Aria`s "Idol Life" (アイドルライフ) which was that week`s number one video. Shauna told Serena while making Poffles at the Pokémon Summer Camp that Aria was now a Pokémon Performer and had become a major player there. Trainers participating in Tripokalons are called Pokémon Performers. Aria still regularly uploads PokéVisions though despite participating in the tournaments. At the time of the Pokémon Summer Camp, Aria held the title of "Kalos Queen" as she had won each tournament three or more times and had entered the Master Class. Ellena While shopping in disguise in a town near Miare City, Ellena met Serena and the two of them spent the day together. Aria almost gave away her true name but caught herself. She dressed up in glasses and a hat. During their time shopping, she gave Serena some advice and told her that Pokémon Performers always need to have the biggest smiles and that Serena needs to smile always. Ellena suggested that they have a double battle and by fighting together with her partner Pokémon, Serena might make a discovery. She explained to Serena that in double battles, the cooperation between Trainer and Pokémon, as well as between the Pokémon themselves, is very important.
